Comment: Jointly with the Committee on Mental Health, Developmental Disability, Alcoholism, Substance Abuse and Disability Services and the Committee on Finance

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend local law number 19 for the year 2014, amending the administrative code of the city of New York relating to increasing the maximum income level qualifying for exemption for rent increases granted to certain senior citizens, and to amend local law number 39 for the year 2014, amending the administrative code of the city of New York relating to increasing the maximum income level qualifying for exemption for rent increases granted to certain persons with disabilities, in relation to extending certain provisions thereof
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Hearing Held by Committee
Items.MatterName: Increasing the maximum income level qualifying for exemption for rent increases granted to certain senior citizens.

Items.Title: Jointly with the Committee on Mental Health, Developmental Disability, Alcoholism, Substance Abuse and Disability Services and the Committee on Finance

A Local Law to amend local law number 19 for the year 2014, amending the administrative code of the city of New York relating to increasing the maximum income level qualifying for exemption for rent increases granted to certain senior citizens, and to amend local law number 39 for the year 2014, amending the administrative code of the city of New York relating to increasing the maximum income level qualifying for exemption for rent increases granted to certain persons with disabilities, in relation to extending certain provisions thereof
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Laid Over by Committee
Items.MatterName: Increasing the maximum income level qualifying for exemption for rent increases granted to certain senior citizens.

Items.MinutesNote: Other Council Members Attending:  Cohen, Ferreras-Copeland, Matteo, Van Bramer, Rosenthal, Grodenchik, Miller, Cornegy, Crowley, Johnson, Gibson, Cumbo and Borelli
